  • Field Details

    • rowsAffected

      public static int rowsAffected

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer(String firstName, String surname, String phoneNumber, String address, String city, String email)
      The constructor method for the Customer class. It is not used but included for the sake of completion.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name of the customer.
      surname - The surname of the customer.
      phoneNumber - The phone number of the customer.
      address - The physical address of the customer for deliveries.
      city - The city in which the customer lives.
      email - The customer's email address.

  • Method Details

    • findCustomerId

      public static int findCustomerId(Connection connection, String firstName, String surname) throws SQLException
      A method to find the customer's ID from the first name and surname entered by the user. This method is used by the captureNewOrder method in the openOrder method in the Order class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method of the program, needed for the PreparedStatements.
      Returns:
      The customer's ID as an integer.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If underlying MySQL service fails.

    • findCustomerName

      public static String findCustomerName(Connection connection, int customerId) throws SQLException
      A method to find the customer full name from the unique customer id. It is invoked in the displayOrder and printInvoice methods in the Order class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      customerId - The unique customer id number passed in as an argument.
      Returns:
      The full name of the customer (firstname and surname concatenated).
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • createNewCustomer

      public static void createNewCustomer(Connection connection, Scanner input, String firstName, String surname) throws SQLException
      This method adds new customers to the database with the input from the user. The method captureNewOrder in the main method checks if an order is for an existing or new customer and invokes this method if it is a new customer.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method, needed for the PreparedStatement.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method that is needed for the methods in the UserInput utility class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • checkForIncompleteCustomerInfo

      public static ArrayList<Integer> checkForIncompleteCustomerInfo(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      This method checks for any incomplete customer info by looking for NULL values. It is invoked in listOrdersWithIncompleteInfo in the main class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList with the unique customer ID's that have incomplete information.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • displayCustomer

      public static void displayCustomer(Connection connection, int customerId) throws SQLException
      A method to display customer details. It is invoked in the listOrdersWithIncompleteInfo method in the main class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      customerId - The unique customer ID passed in as an argument.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • performFieldUpdate

      public static void performFieldUpdate(Connection connection, String fieldToUpdate, String newValue, int customerId) throws SQLException
      A generic method to update any field of the customer table except for the customer_id field which is fixed and unique.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      fieldToUpdate - The field name of the field that needs to be updated. Passed in as an argument.
      newValue - The new value of the field. Passed in as an argument.
      customerId - The unique customer ID number also passed in as an argument.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.
